node.title: ‘My Girlfriend’s Wedding’: Her Life Plays Like a Movie
node.description: Newly restored, Jim McBride’s 1969 documentary is about his lover who gets married to another man. Her story remains anything but boring.

node.title: Your Thursday Briefing: Xi and Putin Show Solidarity
node.description: The leaders met amid pressure from the West.

node.title: Man Set Trailer Home Ablaze After Believing Child Abuser Lived There, Police Say
node.description: The suspect has been identified as 42-year-old Kenneth Bryant, according to the Ocala Police Department in Florida.

node.title: San Francisco to ensure domestic workers get paid sick time
node.description: City to create first-of-its-kind portable benefits system for its 10,000 house cleaners, nannies and gardeners.

node.title: bell hooks, Pathbreaking Black Feminist, Dies at 69
node.description: She insisted that the fight for women’s rights had to take into account the diverse experiences of working-class and Black women.

node.title: The U.S. secretary of state cuts his Asia trip short after a journalist on his plane tests positive.
node.description: By Lara Jakes

node.title: Germany is investigating vaccine opponents over a plot to kill a state governor.
node.description: By Christopher F. Schuetze

node.title: Court's Decision Renders Biden's Vaccine Mandate for Health Care Workers Half-Enforced
node.description: Two preliminary injunctions in federal appeals courts leave the Biden administration's vaccine mandate blocked in 24 states.

node.title: Some Cities, States Exhaust Rental Assistance, Stop Taking Aid Applications Despite Demand
node.description: States like New York and California are also coming close to running out of their rental assistance funding.

node.title: Woman Poisoned Boyfriend's Drink to 'Shut Him Up,' Called Police to Keep Him From Dying
node.description: "I gave him just enough to shut him up and called y'all, so he wouldn't die," said Alvis Parrish, according to a police report.

node.title: Album of birdsongs created by a Darwin PhD student soars to top five of ARIA charts
node.description: An album made up entirely of tweets and squawks from Australian birds makes history by entering the Top Five ARIA album charts, surpassing Mariah Carey and Taylor Swift.

node.title: Manuel Santana, Pathbreaking Spanish Tennis Champion, Dies at 83
node.description: Santana won the French Open twice and captured the U.S. National Championships and Wimbledon, along with winning at the 1968 Olympics.

node.title: David Fuller, Who Killed 2 Women and Sexually Abused Over 100 Corpses, Gets Life in Prison
node.description: Fuller, 67, was arrested in December 2020 for the two separate killings in 1987 after a new examination of old DNA evidence.

node.title: Kentucky Man Plays Piano Tune Amid Rubble of Home Destroyed by Tornado in Touching Clip
node.description: Jordan Baize's sister, Whitney Brown, posted the video of him playing "There's Something About That Name" by Bill and Gloria Gaither.

node.title: Fewer Americans Support Mask, Vaccine Mandates Ahead of Holiday Gatherings, Poll Finds
node.description: Six in 10 Americans say they feel worn out by pandemic-related changes they've had to make to their daily lives.

node.title: All Weather Records Broken in 2021: Temperatures, Rain and Snowfall
node.description: Earlier this week, Los Angeles had a record amount of rainfall, with 2.16 inches of rain, breaking a previous record set in 1888.

node.title: Chicago Woman Who Was Handcuffed Naked Receives $2.9 Million Settlement
node.description: The Chicago City Council approved a settlement on Wednesday for Anjanette Young, a medical social worker who was forced to stand naked in front of a dozen police officers in 2019.

node.title: Here’s what’s behind Britain’s dire estimate of 200,000 new Omicron cases in a day.
node.description: Experts called it ‘a back-of-the-envelope calculation’ that showed how quickly the variant spreads, but also how little is known about it.

node.title: German Police Say 6 Investigated for Threatening to Kill Lawmakers Over COVID Restrictions
node.description: German police raided six locations Wednesday in an investigation into online death threats by far-right groups against several Saxony government officials.

node.title: Former Disney Performer Says Characters Are Only Allowed to Speak English in Viral Video
node.description: The TikToker says that while there are some exceptions now, when she worked at the park the rule was made very clear.

node.title: 'It's a lost art': Local bakeries struggle to find key ingredient — trained, enthusiastic staff
node.description: First it was the butchers, now it could be the bakers. As traditional bakeries face a skilled-worker shortage, the industry calls for schools and governments to do more to encourage apprenticeships across Australia.

node.title: All the COVID news you need from across Australia
node.description: Get up to speed with all of the coronavirus news from across Australia with our COVID blog. Follow live.

node.title: More women sue Tesla over alleged sexual harassment
node.description: The lawyer for the six women suing Tesla for alleged sexual harassment says more women are coming forward with allegations of harassment suffered while employed at the electric car company.
